p: As MAT and MAP safety margins are measured in differing units, standardised z-scores were also calculated for each location to allow comparison between climate variables (Fig. 3A,B). This null modelling indicated that the observed safety margins across 21% (MAT) and 34% (MAP) of vegetation were larger than expected under random expectation (dark red locations; Fig. 3A,B). In these locations, after comparing the observed and expected values, the comparative chance of detecting the observed safety margin was <5% (i.e. z-score =≤1.96, or ≥1.96).
